# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Build Commands
- `pnpm dev` - Start development server
- `pnpm build` - Production build
- `pnpm lint` - Run ESLint
- No test framework currently configured

## Architecture Overview
This is a Next.js 15 portfolio site using:
- **App Router** (`src/app/`) with TypeScript
- **Tailwind CSS** for styling
- **MDX** for blog content (`content/blog/`)
- **YAML** for structured data (`content/projects/`, `content/testimonials/`)

## Key Conventions
- Components in `components/` (PascalCase filenames)
- Utility functions in `lib/` and `hooks/`
- Type definitions in `types/`
- Content schemas in `schemas/`
- Static assets in `public/`

## Content Structure
- Blog posts: `content/blog/*.md` with frontmatter
- Projects: `content/projects/index.yaml`
- Testimonials: `content/testimonials/index.yaml`
</result>

<result>
import fs from "fs";
import path from "path";
import matter from "gray-matter";
import yaml from "yaml";
import type { BlogPost, Project, Testimonial } from "@/types";

const contentDirectory = path.join(process.cwd(), "content");

export function getBlogPosts(): BlogPost[] {
const blogDir = path.join(contentDirectory, "blog");
const files = fs.readdirSync(blogDir).filter((file) => file.endsWith(".md"));

return files
.map((filename) => {
const filePath = path.join(blogDir, filename);
const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(filePath, "utf8");
const { data, content } = matter(fileContents);

return {
slug: filename.replace(".md", ""),
title: data.title,
date: data.date,
excerpt: data.excerpt,
tags: data.tags || [],
content,
};
})
.sort((a, b) => new Date(b.date).getTime() - new Date(a.date).getTime());
}

export function getBlogPost(slug: string): BlogPost | null {
const posts = getBlogPosts();
return posts.find((post) => post.slug === slug) || null;
}

export function getProjects(): Project[] {
const projectsFile = path.join(contentDirectory, "projects", "index.yaml");
const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(projectsFile, "utf8");
const data = yaml.parse(fileContents);
return data.projects || [];
}

export function getTestimonials(): Testimonial[] {
const testimonialsFile = path.join(
contentDirectory,
"testimonials",
"index.yaml"
);
const fileContents = fs.readFileSync(testimonialsFile, "utf8");
const data = yaml.parse(fileContents);
return data.testimonials || [];
}
</result>

<result>
import { notFound } from "next/navigation";
import { MDXRemote } from "next-mdx-remote/rsc";
import { getBlogPost, getBlogPosts } from "@/lib/content";
import { ArrowLeft, Calendar, Tag } from "lucide-react";
import Link from "next/link";

type Props = {
params: Promise<{ slug: string }>;
};

export async function generateStaticParams() {
const posts = getBlogPosts();
return posts.map((post) => ({
slug: post.slug,
}));
}

export async function generateMetadata({ params }: Props) {
const { slug } = await params;
const post = getBlogPost(slug);

if (!post) {
return {
title: "Post Not Found",
};
}

return {
title: `${post.title} | Danny Fotescu`,
description: post.excerpt,
};
}

export default async function BlogPostPage({ params }: Props) {
const { slug } = await params;
const post = getBlogPost(slug);

if (!post) {
notFound();
}

return (
<main className="min-h-screen pt-24 pb-16">
<article className="max-w-3xl mx-auto px-6">
<Link
href="/blog"
className="inline-flex items-center gap-2 text-slate-400 hover:text-white transition-colors mb-8"
>
<ArrowLeft className="w-4 h-4" />
<span>Back to blog</span>
</Link>

<header className="mb-8">
<h1 className="text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold mb-4">{post.title}</h1>

<div className="flex flex-wrap items-center gap-4 text-sm text-slate-400">
<div className="flex items-center gap-2">
<Calendar className="w-4 h-4" />
<time>
{new Date(post.date).toLocaleDateString("en-US", {
year: "numeric",
month: "long",
day: "numeric",
})}
</time>
</div>

{post.tags.length > 0 && (
<div className="flex items-center gap-2">
<Tag className="w-4 h-4" />
<div className="flex gap-2">
{post.tags.map((tag) => (
<span
key={tag}
className="px-2 py-0.5 rounded-full bg-slate-800 text-slate-300"
>
{tag}
</span>
))}
</div>
</div>
)}
</div>
</header>

<div className="prose prose-invert prose-slate max-w-none prose-headings:text-white prose-p:text-slate-300 prose-a:text-blue-400 prose-strong:text-white prose-code:text-blue-300 prose-code:bg-slate-800 prose-code:px-1 prose-code:py-0.5 prose-code:rounded prose-pre:bg-slate-900 prose-pre:border prose-pre:border-slate-800">
<MDXRemote source={post.content} />
</div>
</article>
    </main>
  );
}
</result>

Now I have a good understanding of the codebase. Let me summarize what I've learned:

---

## Codebase Overview

This is a **Next.js 15 portfolio website** for Danny Fotescu, a Product Manager. Here's the architecture:

### Tech Stack
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router and Turbopack
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with typography plugin
- **Animations**: Framer Motion
- **Content**: MDX for blog posts, YAML for structured data
- **UI Utilities**: clsx, tailwind-merge, class-variance-authority
- **Icons**: Lucide React

### Directory Structure
```
/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/
├── src/app/                    # Next.js App Router pages
│   ├── page.tsx               # Homepage with all sections
│   ├── layout.tsx             # Root layout with Navbar/Footer
│   ├── globals.css            # Global styles
│   ├── blog/                  # Blog listing and dynamic [slug] pages
│   └── projects/              # Projects page
├── components/                 # React components (PascalCase)
│   ├── HeroSection.tsx        # Hero banner
│   ├── ProjectsSection.tsx    # Projects grid
│   ├── BlogSection.tsx        # Blog preview
│   ├── TestimonialsSection.tsx
│   ├── Navbar.tsx / Footer.tsx
│   └── ui/                    # Reusable UI primitives
├── content/                    # Content files
│   ├── blog/*.md              # Blog posts with frontmatter
│   ├── projects/index.yaml    # Project definitions
│   ├── testimonials/index.yaml
│   └── variants/              # Job-specific portfolio variants
├── lib/                        # Utility functions
│   ├── content.ts             # Content loading (getBlogPosts, etc.)
│   └── utils.ts               # General utilities
├── types/                      # TypeScript type definitions
├── hooks/                      # React hooks
├── schemas/                    # Content schemas
└── public/                     # Static assets
```

### Key Patterns
1. **Content-driven**: Blog posts are Markdown with gray-matter frontmatter; projects/testimonials are YAML
2. **Server Components**: Pages use server-side data fetching via `lib/content.ts`
3. **Client Components**: Interactive sections use `"use client"` with Framer Motion animations
4. **Styling**: Dark theme (slate-950 background) with gradient accents (blue/purple/pink)

### Critical Files for Implementation

- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/app/page.tsx` - Main homepage orchestrating all sections
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/lib/content.ts` - Content loading logic for blog, projects, testimonials
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/components/HeroSection.tsx` - Example of client component with animations
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/types/index.ts` - Type exports for all content types
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/content/variants/` - Job-specific customization system (new feature area)

I see the issue:
1. The `hero-grid` is a 1-column grid on mobile, 2-column on desktop
2. But the buttons container has `marginLeft: 'auto'` inline, which right-aligns them even in the 1-column layout

The fix is to remove the `marginLeft: 'auto'` on mobile. The cleanest way is to:
1. Remove the inline `marginLeft: 'auto'` from the button container
2. Use a CSS class for the button container that only applies `margin-left: auto` on desktop

     1→import { useMemo, useState } from 'react';
     2→import type { ReactNode } from 'react';
     3→import { motion, AnimatePresence } from 'framer-motion';
     4→import { social } from '../../lib/content';
     5→import type { Profile } from '../../types/variant';
     6→
     7→// Parse {{accent}}...{{/accent}} markers in text
     8→function parseStyledText(text: string): ReactNode[] {
     9→  const parts: ReactNode[] = [];
    10→  let lastIndex = 0;
    11→
    12→  // Use matchAll to avoid global regex state issues
    13→  for (const match of text.matchAll(/\{\{accent\}\}(.*?)\{\{\/accent\}\}/g)) {
    14→    // Add text before the match
    15→    if (match.index! > lastIndex) {
    16→      parts.push(text.slice(lastIndex, match.index));
    17→    }
    18→    // Add styled text
    19→    parts.push(
    20→      <span key={match.index} style={{
    21→        color: 'var(--color-accent)',
    22→        fontFamily: 'var(--font-serif)',
    23→        fontStyle: 'italic',
    24→        fontWeight: 600,
    25→        fontSize: '1.2em'
    26→      }}>
    27→        {match[1]}
    28→      </span>
    29→    );
    30→    lastIndex = match.index! + match[0].length;
    31→  }
    32→
    33→  // Add remaining text
    34→  if (lastIndex < text.length) {
    35→    parts.push(text.slice(lastIndex));
    36→  }
    37→
    38→  return parts.length > 0 ? parts : [text];
    39→}
    40→
    41→interface AboutSectionProps {
    42→  profile: Profile;
    43→  isMobile: boolean;
    44→  isTablet: boolean;
    45→  sectionPadding: string;
    46→}
    47→
    48→export default function AboutSection({ profile, isMobile, isTablet, sectionPadding }: AboutSectionProps) {
    49→  const { about, photo, name } = profile;
    50→  const [photoError, setPhotoError] = useState(false);
    51→  const [emailCopied, setEmailCopied] = useState(false);
    52→
    53→  const handleCopyEmail = () => {
    54→    navigator.clipboard.writeText(profile.email);
    55→    setEmailCopied(true);
    56→    setTimeout(() => setEmailCopied(false), 2000);
    57→  };
    58→
    59→  // Get social links
    60→  const linkedinLink = social.links.find(l => l.platform === 'linkedin');
    61→  const githubLink = social.links.find(l => l.platform === 'github');
    62→  const twitterLink = social.links.find(l => l.platform === 'twitter');
    63→
    64→  const initials = useMemo(() => {
    65→    const parts = name.split(' ').filter(Boolean);
    66→    const computed = parts
    67→      .slice(0, 2)
    68→      .map((p) => p[0])
    69→      .join('')
    70→      .toUpperCase();
    71→    return computed || 'ME';
    72→  }, [name]);
    73→
    74→  return (
    75→    <section id="about" style={{
    76→      padding: sectionPadding,
    77→      maxWidth: 'var(--layout-max-width)',
    78→      margin: '0 auto',
    79→      position: 'relative',
    80→      zIndex: 1
    81→    }}>
    82→      {/* Section label */}
    83→      <div style={{
    84→        display: 'flex',
    85→        alignItems: 'center',
    86→        gap: 'var(--space-lg)',
    87→        marginBottom: isMobile ? 'var(--space-xl)' : '40px'
    88→      }}>
    89→        <span style={{
    90→          fontSize: '11px',
    91→          fontWeight: 600,
    92→          letterSpacing: '0.15em',
    93→          textTransform: 'uppercase',
    94→          color: 'var(--color-text-muted)'
    95→        }}>
    96→          About
    97→        </span>
    98→        <div style={{
    99→          flex: 1,
   100→          height: '1px',
   101→          background: 'var(--color-border-light)'
   102→        }} />
   103→      </div>
   104→
   105→      <div style={{
   106→        display: 'grid',
   107→        gridTemplateColumns: isMobile ? '1fr' : isTablet ? '180px 1fr' : '280px 1fr',
   108→        gap: isMobile ? '40px' : isTablet ? 'var(--space-2xl)' : '80px',
   109→        alignItems: 'start'
   110→      }}>
   111→        {/* Photo + Social Icons */}
   112→        <div style={{ maxWidth: isMobile ? '180px' : '100%' }}>
   113→          {/* Photo */}
   114→          <div style={{
   115→            aspectRatio: '3/4',
   116→            background: 'linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-background-secondary) 0%, var(--color-background-tertiary) 100%)',
   117→            border: '1px solid var(--color-photo-border)',
   118→            position: 'relative',
   119→            overflow: 'hidden'
   120→          }}>
   121→            {!photoError ? (
   122→              <img
   123→                src={photo}
   124→                alt={name}
   125→                loading="lazy"
   126→                decoding="async"
   127→                style={{
   128→                  width: '100%',
   129→                  height: '100%',
   130→                  objectFit: 'cover'
   131→                }}
   132→                onError={() => setPhotoError(true)}
   133→              />
   134→            ) : (

   136→                aria-label={`${name} photo unavailable`}
   137→                style={{

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>
